result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Demetrius D Martin was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Demetrius D Martin is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Conspiracy, Domestic Abuse Incident], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).
  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/As a Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(5).
  • Demetrius D Martin was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/As a Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. Additional Statements by Sherron M.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to all other counts and all other sentences, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to all other counts and all other sentences, term to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with pending counts.
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to all other counts and all other sentences, term to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with pending counts.
AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to all other counts and all other sentences, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 5
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to all other counts and all other sentences, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 6
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to all other counts and all other sentences, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEARS. 

AS TO ALL COUNTS - TERMS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Tasha C.
-No VIOLENT contact with Sherron M.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Cognitive Thinking/Intervention Program
-No contact with firearms.
-Court WAIVED ALL court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, DNA & DV surcharges, due to inability to pay, and previous payment of DNA surcharge.
-Defendant previously provided DNA sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*No credit granted.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Discussion regarding Repeater and Habitual Criminality enhancers. For reasons placed on the record the state motioned the court to Amend Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 & 6 to REMOVE the Repeater or Habitual Repeater enhancers. Defense did not object. Further discussion regarding state's motion. Court GRANTED state's request. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 - Repeater enhancer is REMOVED from charge 939.62(1)(b)
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3 - Repeater enhancer is REMOVED from charges (939.62(1)(a)
AS TO COUNTS 4, 5 & 6 - Habitual Criminality enhancer is REMOVED from charges (939.62(1)(b)
Received & Filed.

cf

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Greg Renden in person, and Lori A. Kuehn via telephone.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kuehn unable to appear in person, Attorney Renden appeared on behalf of the SPD. The Deputy advised the court the Jury has reached a verdict. The jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict which was then read.  

AS TO COUNT 1: GUILTY.

AS TO COUNT 2: GUILTY.

AS TO COUNT 3: GUILTY. 

AS TO COUNT 4: GUILTY.   To the question "Was the defendant's act in furtherance of any conspiracy?" - YES

AS TO COUNT 5: GUITLY.   To the question "Does the defendant have a prior conviction for a violation of Intimidation of a Witness under ss. 940.42 or Intimidation of a Victim under 940.45?" - YES

AS TO COUNT 6: GUILTY.  To the question "Does the defendant have a prior conviction for a violation of Intimidation of a Witness under ss. 940.42 or Intimidation of a Victim under 940.45?" - YES

AS TO COUNT 7: NOT GUILTY.

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict as to Count 1, and state's judgment of acquittal on Count 2, and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict as to Count 1. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.   Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm and must submit a DNA sample. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court did NOT order a P.S.I in this case.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of Jury Question. Court held in chambers conversation with state and defense counsel.  Jury in the box. Court address Jury Question regarding instruction. Jury out of the box deliberations continued.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of Jury Question. Jury in the box. Court replayed 911 CD for the Jury. Jury out of the box deliberations continued.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in box.  Court Continued instruction of the jury. Court charged the jury.  Jury retired to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies, who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Discussion regarding scheduling. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or remain silent. Court found defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify, will not testify.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  State rests. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Jury in box. Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense. Court instructed and released jury for the day, ordered to return at 10:00 AM in branch 23. Jury out of the box.  Received & Filed, 2 transcripts of calls. Case adjourned for Jury Trial in branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial proceeded.  State played audio exhibits of phone calls (portions published) to the jury. Jury instructed and released for lunch. Jury out of the box. Case adjourned to 1:30 PM.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Arguments heard as to which recordings will be played before the jury.  The defendant contends that he has not heard all of the recordings.  Court advised the parties that the defendant will be given time to review the recordings.  Jury in box at 10:18 am.  Sworn for the State:  Joseph Link - Investigator.  Exhibits #14-16 offered and received.   Court instructed jury.  The State played portions of Exhibit #18 in open court.  Jury out of box at 10:47 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial proceeded.  Jury in the box. Continued Testimony of Milwaukee Police Officer Dawn Berger, who remained under oath. Received into evidence exhibit #13.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Deputy Sheriff Dennis O'Donnell. Jury out of the box. Court addressed disclosure of state's witness O'Donnell on the record. Arguments from state and defense, ruling placed on the record. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Continued Testimony of Milwaukee County Deputy Sheriff Dennis O'Donnell. Sworn for the state: Tasha G. Jury out of the box. Court held colloquy with witness regarding testifying. Jury in the box. Continued testimony of Tasha G. Received into evidence state's exhibit #21. Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office Investigator Carl Buschmann. Received into evidence, state's exhibits 22 & 17, 18, 19, and 20. Court instructed and released the jury for the day. Jury ordered to return at 9:30 AM on 1/13/2015 in branch 23. Jury out of the box. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Discussion regarding scheduling and Jury Instructions. Case is adjourned to branch 23 for Continued Jury Trial at 9:30 AM in branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in the box.  Jury sworn to try cases. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Aja Chirpke.  Exhibits 2-11 received and published to jury. State's exhibit 12 received, but court denied publication to jury. Sworn for the state: Dawn Berger. Court instructed and released the Jury for lunch, ordered to return at 1:30 PM to branch 23. Jury out of the box. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Case passed to 1:30 PM.
Received & Filed, Letter to the Court.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion regarding pretrial motions and scheduling issues, rulings placed on the record. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded. Jury panel out of the courtroom. Discussion regarding strikes for cause. Jury panel in courtroom. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled. Jury list received and filed. Remaining panel members released to Jury Management. Court instructed and released the jury to 9:15 AM on 1/13/2015 in branch 23. Jury out of the box. Discussion regarding scheduling. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial. 
  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Demetrius D Martin in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Demetrius D Martin in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent, Dawn Berger appeared in court.

Discussion regarding defense subpoena for DOC file. Court ordered state to provide redacted copy of the DOC file, court extended the subpoena.  

Defense Motion to Withdraw. 
Defense motioned the court to withdraw as counsel for reasons placed on the record. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his request for new counsel. Defendant WAIVED his right to a speedy Trial Demand, court GRANTED defense motion to withdraw. SPD ordered to appoint new counsel in this case. Court VACATED 8/19/2014 jury trial date. State advised court of possible new charges, and motion, to be addressed at next court date. Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing/ Status of Counsel date in branch 23. Original Information filed, adding Count 4: Conspiracy To Commit Felony Intimidation of A Victim, Domestic Abuse, Repeater., contrary to Wis Stat. 940.45(4), 939.50(3)(g), 939.31, 968.075(1)(a), and 939.62(1)(b), a Class F Felony.
